div.p: The official URL for this implementation guide is:

description.value: Implementation Guide for testing Claims

valueMarkdown.value: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

description.value: The following artifacts define the types of individuals and/or systems that will interact as part of the use cases covered by this implementation guide.
The following artifacts describe the specific requirements to be met by systems compliant with the implementation guide.

The following artifacts define the specific capabilities that different types of systems are expected to have in order to comply with this implementation guide. Systems conforming to this implementation guide are expected to declare conformance to one or more of the following capability statements.
These are custom operations that can be supported by and/or invoked by systems conforming to this implementation guide.
These define the types of messages that can be sent and/or received by systems conforming to this implementation guide.
These define the properties by which a RESTful server can be searched. They can also be used for sorting and including related resources.
These define activities that can be performed as part of content in this implementation guide.
These define workflows, rules, strategies, or protocols as part of content in this implementation guide.
These define measures as part of content in this implementation guide.
These define logic, asset collections and other libraries as part of content in this implementation guide.
These define collections of interrelated resources that are useful to pass around as a group.
These define data models that represent the domain covered by this implementation guide in more business-friendly terms than the underlying FHIR resources.
These define forms used by systems conforming to this implementation guide to capture or expose data to end users.

These are profiles on resources or data types that describe patterns used by other profiles, but cannot be instantiated directly. I.e. instances can conform to profiles *based* on these abstract profiles, but do not declare conformance to the abstract profiles themselves.
These define constraints on FHIR resources for systems conforming to this implementation guide.
These define constraints on FHIR data types for systems conforming to this implementation guide.
These define constraints on FHIR data types for systems conforming to this implementation guide.
These define sets of codes used by systems conforming to this implementation guide.
These define new code systems used by systems conforming to this implementation guide.
These define identifier and/or code system identities used by systems conforming to this implementation guide.
These define transformations to convert between data structures used by systems conforming to this implementation guide.
These define transformations to convert between codes by systems conforming with this implementation guide.
These test plans are available to verify test coverage for this implementation guide
These test definitions are available to FHIR test engines to verify systems are conforming to this implementation guide
These define groups of interrelated examples that demonstrate one or more of the workflows supported by this implementation guide.
These are example instances that show what data produced and consumed by systems conforming with this implementation guide might look like.
These are example instances that are not governed by this implementation guide, but which are necessary to support other examples defined in the IG.
These are resources that are used within this implementation guide that do not fit into one of the other categories.
A profile representing submitted claims from providers to payers.
A profile capturing a patient's insurance coverage details.
A profile representing patient encounters related to claims.
A profile for invoices generated by providers for reimbursement.
A profile representing clinical or diagnostic findings used in claims.
A profile for provider and payer organizations.
A profile representing patients involved in insurance claims.
A profile representing healthcare professionals who submit claims.
A profile for defining the role of a practitioner within a claims-processing organization.
A profile for clinical procedures tied to a submitted claim.
A profile for workflow and task management in insurance processing.
A profile representing responses from insurers regarding submitted claims.
A profile for checking patient's eligibility for insurance services.
A profile for the insurer’s response to an eligibility check.
A profile detailing adjudicated claim results.
This CodeSystem defines ward codes and names mapped to their respective Local Government Areas (LGAs) in Nigeria.

A standardized classification system used to describe the type or level of health facility within a healthcare delivery system, based on the scope of services provided, staffing, infrastructure, and administrative role.
The administrative gender of a person.
Subset of HL7 administrative-gender limited to 'male' and 'female'.
Classification of Nigerian health facilities
The Patient's preferred language for communication.
This CodeSystem defines LGA codes and names mapped to their respective States in Nigeria.
The administrative Local Government Areas where a person or a facility is.
The owner of an Immunization location
This CodeSystem defines Immunization Location Owner.

name.value: NG-Imm Search Bundle by Last Updated Date

description.value: Retrieve bundles based on last updated timestamp

name.value: NG-Imm Search Bundle by Organization Identifier

description.value: Retrieve bundles that reference a specific healthcare organization/facility

name.value: NG-Imm Search Bundle by Patient BirthDate

description.value: Retrieve bundles where the Patient has a specific birth date

name.value: NG-Imm Search Bundle by Patient Identifier

description.value: Allows search of NgImmBundle resources where the embedded Patient has a specific identifier (e.g., NIN)

name.value: NG-Imm Search Bundle by Patient State

description.value: Retrieve bundles where the Patient resides in a specific Nigerian State

name.value: NG-Imm Search Bundle by Vaccine Code

description.value: Searches bundles containing a specific vaccine code in Immunization
Search by patient LGA of residence

name.value: NG-Imm Search Immunization by date of vaccination

description.value: Search Immunization records by date of vaccination

name.value: NG-Imm Search Immunization by immunization status

description.value: Search Immunization records by status (eg. completed, or not done)
Search Immunization records by patient

name.value: NG-Imm Search Immunization by vaccine code

description.value: Search Immunization records by vaccination code

name.value: NG-Imm Search Patient by birth date

description.value: Search by patient birth date
Search patient records by city, town or settlement

name.value: NG-Imm Search Patient by date of creation or update

description.value: Search by patient's creation or last updated date (range supported)
Search by patient firstname
Search by patient gender
Search by patient identifier
Search by patient lastname

name.value: NG-Imm Search patient by phone or email

description.value: Search patient record by phone number or email address
Search by patient's State of residence
This CodeSystem defines ward codes and names mapped to their respective States in Nigeria.
The state where a person or a facility is.
The administrative Ward (within an LGA) where a person or a facility is.
This CodeSystem defines codes for major languages spoken across Nigeria.
